alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:30AM MST until January 14 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, locally up to 12 inches north slopes of the Uintas. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph will cause widespread blowing and drifting of snow. * WHERE...Southwest Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Check for road closures before traveling.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
